authors.name: Hua  Tian
authors.affiliation: Department of Chemistry, Pennsylvania State University

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4n33m","text":"Imaging mass spectrometry (IMS) is able to image the multiple lanthanides-tagged antibodies (up to 40) simultaneously at a subcellular resolution on a single tissue section. This protocol is developed for optimized immunostaining of frozen-hydrated tissue with antibodies cocktail (10-25 Abs), which produces consistent antibody affinity and improved IMS image quality using C60-secondary ion mass spectrometry (C60-SIMS).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: lanthanides-tagged antibody, immunostaining, imaging mass spectrometry, secondary ion mass spectrometry, C60-SIMS
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"2khvj","text":"• Five micrometer fresh snap-frozen human liver sections on Au-coated Silicon wafer (2.2cm*2.2cm)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2erf1","text":"• 1% Paraformaldehyde (diluted from 16% solution from Thermo Fisher Scientific)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78a7i","text":"• Methanol (Sigma)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73f1r","text":"• 3% Goat serum (diluted from 10% stock from Thermo Fisher Scientific)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ao3op","text":"• DPBS (Corning)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftik0","text":"• Wash buffer [DPBS supplemented with 0.05% Tween(Thermo Fisher Scientific) and 1% BSA(Sigma)]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qhs6","text":"• Metal-conjugated antibodies as in Table 1 below. Please refer to Fluidigm Maxpar Antibody Labeling User Guide Chapter 3 for detailed conjugation steps. status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2euq1","text":"Cut the fresh frozen sections at 5µm using a cyromicrotome and mount them on Au-coated silicon slides","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ac620","text":"Place the slides at -20 ◦C for 1h and then at 4 ◦C for 30 min for temperature equilibrium","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ejrpe","text":"Fix the tissue slides in 1% PFA for 5 min at 4 ◦C, then in prechilled methanol for 5 min at -20 ◦C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f2984","text":"Wash the slides twice for 5 min in a glass petri dish by submerging the slides in 25 ml wash buffer, following by rehydrating the slides for 5 min in a glass container with 25ml DPBS and rinsing the slides for 5 min in a glass container with 25ml wash buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eldaj","text":"Use the Liquid-Repellent Slide Marker Pen to draw a circle around the tissue section to create a barrier to contain the solutions on the tissue sections","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4b3iu","text":"Apply 100 µl 3% goat serum solution to each slide for 1 h at RT and then remove excess block solution by tapping on a tissue","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7s1rs","text":"Prepare the antibody cocktail. Vortex all the antibodies for 15 s and then centrifuge at 12,000G for 2 min, followed by diluting the upper liquid of each antibody in 0.5% PBS as desired concentration","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6lv8","text":"Add 100 µl of the antibody cocktail to each section and incubate overnight at 4◦C in a sealed glass petri dish in a fridge","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5dvls","text":"After the incubation, wash the sections two times for 5min in a glass petri dish with 5 ml wash buffer with slow agitation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"38nrj","text":"Incubate the slides with 100 µl 1:100 dilution of Intercalator-Ir in DPBS for 30 min at RT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"79tqk","text":"After nuclei staining, wash the slides for 5 min in a glass container with 5 ml DPBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1s33h","text":"Quickly dip the slides in a container with 5 ml DI water for 15 s, repeat three times","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8defu","text":"Dry the slides in a fume hood at RT for 20 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ta3m","text":"Wear proper PPE when handling the agents. Discard the waste in the biohazard waste container","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
